BushTripInjector.ChangeLog:
4.3.0.4866 - Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Part V This Version has many changes in the core functionality of BushTripInjector. Despite intensive testing, bugs and problems may occur. If you have an issue, please contact me on Discord: BushTripInjector Discord. Thank you very much. 'Features:'
  • *Intersections:* Add the ICAO Airport to Intersections (named/unnamed waypoints, RNAV, ...) in PLN file when navaid database is installed.
  • *Intersections:* Choose whether Intersections should always be changed to User-WP, or if they do not exist, or not at all.
  • *User-WP:* The option to choose whether the ident should be added to the user waypoints has been added.
'Updates:'
  • *PLN Generation:* Several changes in the generated PLN file for better GPS handling in MSFS2020 and MSFS2024.
  • *Covers:* Removed some unnecessary entries in the BTI file when no covers were set.
  • *Preflight-Check:* A check has been added to validate if an intersection waypoint is included in the navigation database.
'Fixes:'
  • *Generate-Submission:* Fixed an issue where creating sub-missions for MSFS 2024 would select the wrong simulator.
  • *Covers:* An issue with the visibility of the cover options in non-bush trip missions has been fixed.
--- 4.2.0.4844 - Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Part IV 'Features:'
  • *Aircrafts:* Reading the list of installed aircraft and liveries from MSFS 2024. Note that using a livery will not work due to a bug in MSFS 2024.
  • *Covers:* Added the possibility to define the covers to be mounted on the aircraft before the flight.
'Updates:'
  • *Preflight-Check:* A warning has been added to the preflight check if the title can presumably not be displayed completely in MSFS 2024.
  • *3D Image Generation:* Added the option to start MSFS 2020 and MSFS 2024.
  • *Aircrafts&Liveries:* Added UI output when reading aircraft and liveries.
  • *Aircrafts&Liveries:* The aircraft mapping has been moved from the aircraft database to a separate file on Github: Aircraft Mapping on Github. Contribute by creating a branch, adding the mapping and creating a pull request. I'll review it and then merge the PR.
  • *License-Checks:* Added *www.* prefix to all license check calls to avoid redirecting from the server and speed up the query.
  • *License-Checks:* To speed up the query, all calls to the licence check have been moved to a different endpoint.
  • *Databases:* Updated the databases to AIRAC 2413. Please note: About 10% of the VOR/NDB has been removed. Please check your Usage-Db!
  • *SimConnect:* Updated to MSFS2024 SDK 1.1.2
  • *SimWatcher:* Added the functionality for MSFS 2024
'Fixes:'
  • *Landmarks:* Fixed an issue that prevented the creation of IGM in Event & Trigger from the Landmarks sheet.
--- 4.1.1.4805 - Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Part III: MSFS2024 Release 'Updates:'
  • *User-Interface:* Some restructuring of the menu. I would appreciate feedback on Discord.
  • *Aircrafts:* The option to link between MSFS2020 and MSFS2024 aircraft names has been added internally. You can contribute by adding the *Name2024* attribute to an aircraft in the list of aircrafts on Github: Aircraftlist on Github. See the Baron G58 for an example. For these changes to take effect, you must reload the list via *Extras* → *Load Liveries/Aircrafts*
  • *PropertyDefinitions:* Updated to MSFS2024 1.1.7.0
  • *SimConnect:* Updated to MSFS2024 SDK 1.0.0
  • *Maintenance:* Some minor stability changes.
--- 4.1.0.4790 - Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Part II 'Fixes:'
  • *Start-Up:* Fixed a CTD on Startup with a strange combination of MSFS2020 and MSFS2024 installations.
  • *Sim-Detection:* Fixed some minor issues detecting MSFS2024 with Steam and Store/li>
  • *Sim-Detection:* Fixed an issue detecting MSFS2020 with Steam/li>
  • *Options:* An issue with overlapping fields in the options sheet has been fixed.
'Features:'
  • *Bundles:* Added basic support for Bundles with Flightsimulator 2024
  • *SPB-Decompiler:* The option to decode MSFS 2024 SimPropBinary files (*.spb) has been added.
'Updates:'
  • *Bundles:* Invalid packages and packages with different simulator versions can be recreated when the bundle is generated
--- 4.0.0.4771 - Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 *Basic version to support generation and compilation of MSFS 2024 Bush Trips, Landing Challenges and Discover Flights*
  • Detect Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Store-Version
  • Detect Microsoft Flightsimulator 2024 Steam-Version
  • Configuration for compiling missions with SDK or without SDK
  • Start MSFS 2024 via App Invoker for MS Store Version with Faststart Option
  • Start MSFS 2024 via Steam App Invoker or FlightSimulator.exe for Steam Version with Faststart Option
  • Create new User-Xml-Files for Missions when generating for MSFS 2024
  • Adjustments for the manifest.json in MSFS 2024
  • Several adjustments in Windows and Menus
  • Updated to SimConnect 2024
  • Simulator version added to the user database for future use
*Things that have not yet been implemented, but would be required for smooth operation with MSFS 2024:*
  • Marketplace changes for MSFS 2024
  • SPB Decompiler for MSFS 2024
  • Xml-Importer for MSFS 2024
  • MSFS 2024 Database Handling
  • MSFS 2024 POI Handling
  • Aircraft and Livery Support for MSFS 2024
  • Dependency Handling
  • Magnetic Declination for MSFS 2024
  • Different Usage Database for MSFS 2024
  • and much more, ...
*other changes and fixes:*
  • UPDATE: *PropDefs:* Updated to the most recent Property Definitions of MSFS2020 to avoid conflicts in SPB-Decompiler
  • UPDATE: *Database:* Updated the Database to AIRAC 2410
  • UPDATE: *Database:* Updated the Database for AAU3
  • UPDATE: *Adjust Elevation:* Modified the handling, when no elevation data is available.
  • UPDATE: *Maintenance:* Unnecessary code has been removed
  • UPDATE: *Components:* Updated the WebView2 Runtime, OpenDocument components and Xaml-Behaviors components to the most recent version
  • BUGFIX: *LoadLiveries:* Fixed a null-pointer exception on startup, if there are not well designed liveries or aircrafts in the community folder
  • BUGFIX: *Marketplace-Data:* Fixed a CTD when editing a heading tag without a heading number in the marketplace description preview window.
--- 3.5.0.4714 USER-REQ: *Bushtrip:* The option to provide a requested (an IFR) flight plan to the air traffic control has been added to the base data. USER-REQ: *Waypoints:* Added an option to manually override the altitude of a waypoint to ignore any automatic calculations by BTI or LNM. Useful for altitude restrictions on Navaid waypoints or fictitious restrictions on your trip. USER-REQ: *SimVars:* Added "AMBIENT TEMPERATURE" in SimVarWatcher and A-Vars for PropertyTrigger. FEATURE: *Aircrafts:* Added a cache for the installed aircrafts and liveries.
*Behavior Change:* If you install or remove a new aircraft or livery, you need to update the cache manually via Menu → Tools → Load Liveries/Aircrafts. UPDATE: *Assistance-Options:* Added the assistance option "ATC Enforce Flightplan". UPDATE: *Translate DeepL-App:* Removal of the note for free DeepL app from the translated string and optimization of the clipboard handling. UPDATE: *Databases:* Updated the databases to City Update 7: European Cities II, Sim Update 15 (30.05.2024), Navdata (AIRAC 2406) + WorldHub (17.06.2024), City Update 8 - LasVegas (20.06.2024), City Update 9 - Northeast USA (02.07.2024), Navdata (AIRAC 2407) + World Hub Updates (11.07.2024), World Update 17 United Kingdom & Ireland (23.07.2024), Navdata (AIRAC 2408) + World Hub Updates (09.08.2024), World Update 18 Germany, Austria, and Switzerland (22.08.2024) UPDATE: *Marketplace:* Added a warning message if there are more than 5 tags defined. UPDATE: *SimConnect:* Updated the MSFS SDK Components and SimConnect binaries to SDK Version 0.24.3.0. UPDATE: *Components:* Updated the Microsoft.Xaml.Behaviors.Wpf, Microsoft.Web.WebView2 and DocumentFormat.OpenXml to the most recent version. BUGFIX: *IngameMarker:* Fixed an issue where the IngameMarker texts were not read correctly from the language table and were fixed to the base language. BUGFIX: *ParkingLot on Waypoints:* An unnecessary warning about a LivingWorld exclusion no longer appears when you add parking lots to a waypoint (HOW????). --- 3.4.1.4648 USER-REQ: *Aircraft-List:* The Gotfriends Monster NX has been added to the list of payware aircrafts. BUGFIX: *Flightplan:* Fixed issue that prevented adding location information at a stopover airport when landing options were enabled. --- 3.4.0.4634 - Ingame POI Reader / Usage-Database FEATURE: *Ingame-POI:* Added the ability to read POIs from MSFS and add-ons. Jump to the POI on the world map and export it for Little Navmap! USER-REQ: *Date/Time:* Set the date/time of a mission to the current date and time when the mission is created. USER-REQ: *Aircraft-List:* The Iris PC-21 - PILATUS has been added to the list of payware aircrafts. USER-REQ: *Usage-Database:* Added the possibility to remove projects from the usage database. USER-REQ: *Flightplan:* Added the landing option "On ATC Parking Spot" to the flight plan which allows you to define this option individually for each destination airport. UPDATE: *Databases:* Updated the databases for City Update 6 South West Germany UPDATE: *Databases:* Updated the databases to AIRAC 2404 and recent World-Hub changes. UPDATE: *Marketplace-Profiles:* Some minor optimizations when loading marketplace profiles. UPDATE: *License-Key:* Remove blanks from the key before checking it to avoid some user confusion after copying and pasting the key. UPDATE: *Key-Request:* Added a cooldown period between requests to avoid license request spam! BUGFIX: *CTD:* Fixed a crash to desktop on startup if the simulator was not detected correctly. BUGFIX: *Airport-Creation:* In the north of France, for some reason, Bing Maps cannot provide elevation data. This prevented the creation of airfields at waypoints. * 'Usage-Database'* BUGFIX: *Usage-Database:* BTI incorrectly continued to list DME that was previously a VORDME and had been downgraded as a VOR.
Please *read the instructions* in USAGEDB-VORDME.txt included in this package to check the DME you are using in your missions.
